citeinfo.origin: Ecotrust, Pacific GIS, and Conservation International
citeinfo.title: Bathymetry-Major Contours & Depth Range

descript.abstract: Data Type: Ocean/Coasts ; This layer contains major bathymetric contours and depth ranges suitable for shading based on data provided by Alaska Department of Natural Resources (DNR) for the Exxon Valdez oil spill area. The DNR bathymetric data is based primarily on National Ocean Service (NOS) data. NOS publishes digital bathymetric data in two forms: raw depths of all soundings from included bathymetric surveys; and "gridded" data. Gridded data is a summarization of raw NOS data information and includes the mean, maximum, and minimum depths recorded in each cell in a 15 second latitude by 15 second longitude grid. The Alaska DNR augmented the NOS gridded data with information from NOAA nautical charts and converted it to bathymetric contours (interval = 20 m) and polygons suitable for shading. Please refer to documentation for bath_ln and bath_pt for related databases.

idinfo.accconst: Data transfer costs will be based on staff time and media costs.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
